reviews.text: Booked 2 ice suites (1 art & 1 design) for hubby and 3 sons and 1 warm kaamos room for myself ( not brave enough ) for 1 night.
reviews.title: Nice but too expensive !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall was a nice stay - They didn't sleep well in the ice suites but the kaamos room was nice and the bed very confy. Lovely bathroom too .
reviews.title: Great experience!

reviews.text: There ia a Kettle in the room with tea/coffee .
reviews.title: Pure winter wonderland

likes.liked: — the imaginative design of the ice rooms

reviews.title: Lots of hanging around with nowhere to go
reviews.text: We tried the vodkas cocktails in the ice bar, but they are so small ( ice glasses too thick) and over priced lol

The 2nd night, we spent in scandic ferrum in Kiruna, saving lots of money, instead of spending it in the ice hotel. The scandic is a very good hotel, with lovely sauna in the 5th floor, rooms nice and clean, confy beds.
reviews.title: Expensive, but remarkable experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got taken the Ice Hotel by my boyfriend for a surprise trip. For me it is somewhere I have always wanted to go and it was amazing. If you don't like the snow and the cold, then its not the best place for you. If like me the idea of being in the snow and cold is heaven then its the perfect place to go.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience

reviews.text: Reading other reviews, I do agree that at times it can appear a tourist trap and I don't understand how they make everything so expensive!
reviews.title: Don't go at the end of the season, prices are now v. greedy

likes.liked: — very clean warm rooms, large and well-appointed
likes.disliked: — absence of refunds or alternative activities provided despite the collapse of the around 1/3 of the icehotel

reviews.text: We travelled from Heathrow to Kiruna.....the most annoying part was the long wait at Stockholm airport. If there was a direct flight it would have taken just over 3 hours, instead we spent 3 hour waiting for our connecting flight.
reviews.title: Married at the icehotel – best holiday Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Landing in Kiruna was amazing as everywhere apart from the runway was covered in snow. I am a regular skier and have never seen an airport operate under those conditions.
reviews.title: Iced my Wallet
Plan carefully, and you will enjoy!
reviews.text: Transport to the Ice Hotel was by coach took about 20 minutes. Look out for wildlife and people on skidoos, not many cars about.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really well geared up for those of us who love our creature comforts but like to try new things. The cabins we spent the majority of our stay in were cosy and the night in the ice hotel itself was ... well cold! But really quite something. Not so sure about the hot logan-berry squash in the morning though!
reviews.title: Once in a lifetime experience

likes.liked: — Very well planned to make the most of the experience
likes.disliked: — Lack of access to a shower in the ice hotel itself

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the ice hotel for Christmas 2005. As with most people, we spent one night in the ice hotel proper, followed by another night in one of the hotel rooms. We slept fairly well, not cold really, although if you get up to pee in the middle of the night, expect to have to put clothing/boots/etc. on. The ice suites are cute in design, but you don't get to spend much time in them.
reviews.title: Icehotel - worth doing once

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the money, I though the food was not worth it, certainly true on Christmas eve. The icebar was interesting and the sweet vodka drinks went down easy. People were friendly in the bar as well.
reviews.title: Great experiance but overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For activities, we went cross-country skiing, snow-mobiling, sweating
reviews.title: Married at The Ice church
A Once In A Lifetime Experience.
reviews.text: in the sauna and dog sledding. Other than the sauna, these were not cheap. We did have a blast though. Unfortunately we did not witness the Northern Lights.
Ice hotel in jukkasjarvi (pronounced yukkasyarvi apparently) was excellent. A brilliant once in a lifetime experience.
reviews.title: Icehotel Good, Food Bad, Taxi Ugly

reviews.text: The reception is very helpful and you get a map to help you around. I stayed in the cold rooms for a night so you get to safely store your luggage in the warm dressing room, which has decent toilet and shower and changing room facilities. the sleeping bag they give you for the night is ace, and its no problem getting up for the toilet in the middle of the night. A bit chilly though. Ice sculpture rooms are beautiful and worth taking a look at before people sleep in them. They give you all the clothes you need for sleeping and activities.
reviews.title: A once in a lifetime experience

likes.liked: — The rooms as art gallery and general architecture/design plus excellent excursions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have no experience of the warm accomodation, but it looks very cosy from the outside.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience, shame about the restaurant

likes.liked: — The sheer beauty of all the ice sculptures
likes.disliked: — The glacial service in the restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the downside, the food is a ripoff. I was tres hungry fromt eh cold and skiing and for ~400sek, i got a tiny sausage, two lamb chops, not more than twice the size of a two pence coin, and a mushy mushroom thing. It was crap to be honest. i'd advice walking for 10minutes down the road to their other restaurant which is the lesser of two evils. slightly cheaper and slighty more food. there's also a convenience store 5mins away too.
reviews.title: Beware the trips

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The taxi service is a major ripoff if you're travelling into kiruna town. 350sek in the daytime and 400sek on the weekends, all fixed prices. the airport fare is probably 300sek, but i travelled from kiruna town centre.
reviews.title: Overpriced, but excellent!

likes.disliked: — For that price it should be at least half board!
